author: Katie Jerkovich
title: Tapper Blasts Iranian Leader For Praising Anti-Trump Oscar Speech
text:
— Jake Tapper (@jaketapper) February 27, 2017 
“3/Jafar Panahi was sentenced to six years in prison for trying to make an ‘antiregime’ documentary,” he continued. 3/Jafar Panahi was sentenced to six years in prison for trying to make an “antiregime” documentary https://t.co/JBtg9KE86b

— Jake Tapper (@jaketapper) February 27, 2017 6/ So FM @JZarif ? The traditions of your brilliant people are being oppressed by the tyranny of your government. Tweets notwithstanding 
— Jake Tapper (@jaketapper) February 27, 2017 
On Sunday, the Iranian Asghar Farhadi blasted Trump’s travel ban as “inhumane” during his acceptance speech at the Oscars. The director did not attend the 89th Annual Academy awards show in protest of Trump’s travel ban. In a statement read by a friend at the ceremony, he said the ban was nothing but a “deceitful justification for aggression and war.”
